It's so weird to me that Debbie and Tai are the only two who haven't gone a single episode without a confessional. Wanner edit = winner edit confirmed?

The second he started going into his military metaphors again my eyes rolled farther back in my head than Ciera's. It's like he copied and pasted himself from MvGX into this season and it's so not entertaining.
Well of course they're offended by bad gameplay when it's meant to screw them over.
Well he's not living with Jason and Scot
It was short-sighted for sure. I can understand why he did it, but he definitely did not put any thought into it before trying to execute it.

WRITING.TITLE: Have to keep the chain going

WRITING.TEXT: I thought Nicole chose Hali and Rob chose Ozzy?

I was happy when Malcolm went home because everyone and their mother had him as their winner's pick and because I thought he was going to gun for Sandra and get her out. Looking back now, with the people who are left in the game, and what actually ended up happening...I'm sad.
I *really* like the music in the original trailer, but I love the sound design, it adds so much!
Agreed. I feel like David or Jay would have made more sense.
That's not even true lol. That alliance *wanted* to keep him in the game. If he laid back he probably would've been good until the merge.
Yes but I think she said something like "normally I'm not a big drinker".
And Tony too I guess, if he didn't go crazy we could've still had the dream alliance and the immunity challenges probably would've turned out differently.
You're right, I only made it a close vote because I would hate all three of those people getting jury votes and none of them being a clear goat, but 10-0-0 probably would be worse.

Or a Cirie/Aubry/Michaela F3. If Zeke's move this week does impact the rest of the merge, I think it'd be fair to say Zeke was a large reason this season didn't turn out well. He's the one who led the charge to get out Sandra, he's the one who tried to screw over the Cirie alliance, etc.
I mean Troyzan could make it to the end with Sierra and Zeke and beat them 5-3-2. I think that would be worse.
Idk about Michelle didn't she talk about how she didn't like drinking in her ponderosa videos? I can't imagine her being a big pot enthusiast.
Featuring WTF casting choices like Francesca Hogi X Eddie Fox
Can you imagine how perfect a couple they would be if they dated?

And what's more, her pitch to him was that she would need his help getting to the end, and the person she wanted to vote out was Tai. Turns out, he did need her help not being targeted after the merge, and Tai ended up being one of the people to betray him.
Except in KR people were immediately put off by her trying to form alliances with them postmerge, in this season everyone went with it when she dictated the vote.

A bad boot orderr isn't immediate, it's a progression
Yeah I think this sums it up pretty well. It's been entertaining on an episode by episode basis, but the long-term isn't looking so hot, and I think at a certain point it's going to slam into a wall and stop being fun instantly when there's no one fun left in like the F7.
It's weird because the boot order is pretty much the worst it could possibly be at this point, but it's been entertaining the entire time.
This was also the first time Aubry got anything other than 2 votes I think.
Cirie is God, Michaela is Jesus, and Aubry is the Holy Spirit?

I think the merge at 13 only works if there's been one or less tribe swap. The merge in MvGX was pretty straightforward, but the ones in Cambodia and this season have been huge clusterfucks where it's impossible to tell who is doing what.
In that season, yes it was.

Eh I don't think so. I don't think most casuals at this point would remember Hannah but they would probably have remembered Aubry before the GC cast was announced. I guess we do have to wait to see who is remembered long term but I easily see Aubry being one of those people.
I guess I understand why everyone had the beef in the first place, what I don't understand is why everyone is so vindictively and stubbornly sticking to the beef instead of squashing it.

I think what elevates her to a legend status imo was her popularity in KR, even among casual fans. I think if you could go up to a casual viewer, mention a player's name, and have them recognize it, that player should be considered a legend.

I don't know about thaaaat. Tell me who wouldn't vote for her out there right now.
I think the mistake you are making, and a lot of people on the sub make, is not being able to separate your own views of Debbie on TV and how other players feel about her. We've only ever heard positive things about Debbie from the other castaways (aside from the Brad incident). Cydney and Michele both called her motherly in KR, and now in this season, her and Sierra supposedly have a close alliance, Tai seems to have respect for her, Brad has forgiven her for the outburst and has repeatedly told her he loves her, etc. She's not as much of a goat as you think.

I know she got saved, and it was in part due to the bond she built with Cirie, but at the same time I feel like it was more Cirie's doing than hers that she didn't go home. I was afraid for a while there that she was going to make the Michelle Schubert mistake of laying too low while the votes are coming for her. Is it possible to take the lesson she learned from her last season too far?
Yikes.
I would consider Aubry a legend.

Well I'm glad Cirie finally showed up to play this season. The first episode of the season wasn't a good look for her but now that she's managed to gain her footing she's playing the best social game out there.

She's not...on the bottom, I don't think? I don't know, the lines don't really seem to be as concrete as Debbie was saying in the NTOS. Even if her alliance got outvoted, she's far from the bottom or the biggest target in it so I think she's good.

She should be the second player of the week behind Cirie imo. I loved it when she didn't buy into what Zeke was feeding her even though it was the truth. She's somehow made up for her mental breakdown earlier and is now in control.

She was on the bottom the entire game so it was only a matter of time. It was interesting hearing Sierra say though that she was playing a completely different game. Yet she still ended up in the same place, if not slightly better.

WRITING.TITLE: __ is killing it and I think they need more appreciation
WRITING.TEXT: Debbie. Not sure what everyone's beef is with her, but you have to admit she managed to turn her game around this episode and reverse the huge mistake she made when she blew up at Brad. People have this weird insistence on hating Debbie but she's really entertaining to me. What makes her different from Phillip is that she's actually good at the game, and she actually has funny moments that aren't just her being delusional about her placement in the game. Idk I've just seen everyone praising Cirie for her performance in these two episodes (and rightfully so!) but Debbie played just as well.
...how? Last time she got voted off because she was overplaying and being too aggressive, and because she was a loose cannon. How has she done either of those things this season.
Yeah I really don't understand why so many people have such an insistence on finding reasons to hate her no matter what she does.
In what world is Debbie not good TV?
Yeah and Debbie's edit this episode was really delicate.
Debbie was great this episode. She's a crazy old dingbat, but she's always been really skilled at this game.
Which, like...does he not understand modern Survivor at all? People don't care about that ish anymore, especially not on a season called Game Changers.
Could this season's boot order get much worse? We still have Cirie and Aubry but the final 11 consists of Brad, Troyzan, Sierra, Andrea, Zeke, and Tai. Like this has to be the darkest timeline.
Cut to All Winners Season, Final 4: Sandra, wins her first ever immunity, guaranteed spot in the final 3!
Instead he chose to take Tai, who ended up voting him out. SWEET JUSTICE.
I don't know once she said that it looked a lot like she was going out of her way to fake it.
Debbie was incredibly entertaining this episode. THIS is the Debbie I missed from KR.
Did Zeke ever stop being a gamebot? The only non-gamebot content we've gotten from him since he started the fire in MvGX was the whole transgender thing, but that wasn't even his doing.

Yes, absolutely. The most important thing in Survivor is to go with the flow. If the tide is pushing you one way, you'd better not try and change it unless you're Poseidon himself. Zeke was not Poseidon, tried to change the vote in a direction no one wanted it to go in, and made the same exact mistake he made in MvGX.
Andrea is growing on me

He came off really negative in this episode and I don't think he's really been respectable since Cook Islands. In Micronesia he was a part of the ugly popular kids alliance, in SP...well that was SP and everything in it looked bad, and he was shown up by Sophie, and now he was blindsided by Debbie of all people, and when things weren't going his way in the challenge he tried to threaten Tai to stand down. I really don't appreciate Ozzy at all he's not good at anything besides challenges.

Seriously? It's been 6 hours since the episode aired and you already feel the need to post a meme? Like for fucks sake I don't mind memes when they're like on Monday or Tuesday and good discussion has run out but this is just ridiculous.
My dad always said that putting salt on watermelon made it sweeter, but it always just tasted salty. I don't buy this.

The Leftover Titans. Humanity is forced to live inside three large walls to protect themselves from man-eating giants called titans, but one day, everything changes when 2% of the Titan population disappears. In the years following this Departure, humans and titans alike struggle to grasp why the titans exist and where the departed ones went.

Well they don't know we know they know we know!
Ah yes, the prankers, become the prankees!
Anyone who has a guaranteed in to the F3 you want out because that creates a narrower opening for you to get in.
Yeah and she's not really a hero either
You must be fun at parties
Unfortunately I think it would take too much work for one fan to do, and Nintendo would probably take it down right away anyways. A man can dream though...

Gonna make a bold prediction and say the two people who are left out of the merge feast go to a redemption island style duel where one of them has to go up against one of the Outcast tribe and if they win, they stay in the game, but if they don't, the outcasts get to vote in two people into the game. The outcasts win and vote in Sandra and Malcolm. Sandra gathers up all of her goaty alpha males and votes out Ozzy and Zeke as revenge for getting her out.

WRITING.TEXT:
Is there really much to analyze? It seemed pretty straightforward to me that it was Nora living in a hidden identity in the future in Australia because shit goes south, Kevin somehow leaves, and she decides to live out the rest of her life being a quiet pigeon collector.
Knowing Damon Lindelof, though, it'll probably end up being some alternate universe mumbo jumbo where Sarah is Nora from the purgatory world and Kevin will end up meeting her and have to learn some lesson from her.

I'm not varner but I know if I was in his shoes I would appreciate any support I could get, the more the merrier, and 2. you can't say that and then turn around and say "Zeke needs more support than just family and friends" with no clear justification.
If he needs support then he needs to express that. People aren't mind readers and can't be expected to give a disproportionate amount of support to someone who is acting like they don't need it.

Tai: Jeff! I like to play this immunity idol on Debbie because she not deserve to go home as much as Brad...
Debbie: Not at ALL! I don't deserve to home AT ALL! AT ALL!
Tai: *flinches* And I like to play this other one *reaches in pocket* for Brad because he is my friend...
Jeff: You just made the BIGGEST MOVE in the HISTORY of this game!
Hali: But someone has to go home...
Sandra: *arrives via chopper* That's right, and it's you Jeff. What you don't know is, when you snuff out the Queen's torch, she buries you. *she tosses his snuffer in the fire* Jeff, the tribe has spoken. Adios.
Michaela: *sipping water* Bye Felicia.

They're both pretty dumb in this argument tbh.

She's a jack of all trades but a master of none. She's good in challenges, but I don't see her winning many immunities. She is good at strategizing but is often outwitted by other players. She is socially adept but isn't able to put that to use for her.
Has no desire to work with her former Mana tribemates, which may come back to bite her. I could also see her getting blindsided by Brad.
She's in the Mana minority and her two closest allies just went home. That's about all I can think of.
No one in their right mind would let him make it far, he has a big enemy in Debbie, and I don't see him performing well at FTC
She's going to be potentially the biggest target out of the gate, with a combination of a dangerous reputation and a weaker relationship with the other Nukus than they have with each other.
It worked for Erinn though.
Not many people out there seem to be fond of her, and she doesn't have many connections at this point.
Is playing too under the radar, and can't articulate herself well enough.

Even if he did make it to the end, there's no way a highly-game-changing-focused jury would give him the million dollars. His gameplay is too physical and not strategic enough, and this was his fourth try.
He's just not likable enough
He can't make it far because, like in MvGX, people will realize what a big threat is and vote him out. His fatal flaw is lacking subtlety about his game.
The edit is not on her side.
He just doesn't have the social grace or strategic edge to be able to win.
She's gotten too emotional and irrational for her own good. She still has some good social bonds but I don't think the other players take her as seriously now.
